info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 8:59AM EDT until April 8 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio...
Saint Joseph River Ohio below Montpelier affecting Williams County.
For the Saint Joseph River Ohio...including Montpelier...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Saint Joseph River Ohio below Montpelier.
* WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, County Road K, one mile southwest of Montpelier is flooded. Flood waters affect the southeast side of Pioneer and cover large areas of low land and agricultural land near the river.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM EDT Friday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM EDT Friday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.7 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY AFTERNOON
